thread.title: UK services sector slows down in September
thread.title_full: UK services sector slows down in September

title: UK services sector slows down in September
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Mon, Oct 5, 2015, 11:44 BST - UK Markets close in 4 hrs 46 mins UK services sector slows down in September By Daniel Cancian | Sharecast â€“ 59 minutes ago UBGXF 0.00 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Growth in the UK services sector remained sluggish in the third quarter, data released on Monday showed. The headline figure for the seasonally adjusted Markit (NasdaqGS: MRKT - news ) /CIPS UK services business activity index fell from 55.6 in August to 53.3 last month, marking the third consecutive monthly decline and the weakest level of growth since April (LSE: 0N69.L - news ) 2013. 
Meanwhile, the average reading for the index over the third quarter as a whole stood at 55.4, the weakest since the second quarter of 2013. 
The rate of expansion in new business declined for the fifth time in six months in September, while the overall pace of growth was the slowest since April 2013. 
The forward-looking indicator for business expectations fell to a 13-month low in September, but still signalled solid overall growth, while new business orders delivered a further increase in the level of outstanding business in September. 
"Weakness is spreading from the struggling manufacturing sector, hitting transport and other industrial-related services in particular," said Markit's chief economist Chris Williamson. 
"There are also signs that consumers have become more cautious and are pulling back on their leisure spending, such as on restaurants and hotels. 
"Wider business service sector confidence has meanwhile also been knocked by global economic worries and financial market jitters (Other OTC: UBGXF - news ) ."
